description.narrative: Strategies in the Court of Cassation for “disseminating code of ethics”, “strengthening transparency” and “increasing trust in the judiciary” in line with universal values, good practices and lessons learned in other countries.

- Establishment of and Ethics Advisory Boar and a Personnel Ethics Committee within CoC by 2017 - Number of news items referring to the efforts of the CoC on enhancing ethics - Increase in the number of references to the code of judicial conduct for CoC in international and national policy documents - 20% of the measures in the Transparency strategy implemented by 2018 - At least 20 more high courts recognize the Istanbul Principles on Transparency in Judicial Process by end of 2018 - Smooth relationships between CoC, relevant institutions and citizens creating and environment free from bias - Establishment of a public relations unit within the CoC in line with principles of transparency

comment.narrative: - Code of Ethics for CoC personnel, judges, members and prosecutors drafted in 2013 - Assessment of CoC on the needs for enhancing transparency in the judiciary undertaken in 2014 - No baseline specifically on public awareness regarding the CoC's work

- Present Istanbul Declaration to ECOSOC - Organize 1 day knowledge sharing program among the Faculties of Law on ethic principles - Printing and publishing of materials on ethic and transparency - Establishment of survey system for the front office of Court of Cassation - Organize 1 consultation group meeting on Communication Strategy and 1 consultation group meeting on Transparency Strategy. - Organize meeting with media representatives to disseminate the information on judiciary ethic, Istanbul Declaration and reforms of Court of Cassation. - Organize training on Istanbul Declaration for media representatives - Organize training on ethics for Public Prosecutors, Reporter Judges, Personnel and Members to have not received the dissemination program during 2018.

) short-term expert support for strengthened transparency in judicial processes; specifically for better dissemination of Istanbul Declaration and Implementing Measures on Transparency in Judicial Process, ii) training on ethics for the CoC including new and existing members who have not participated into former trainings, iii) printing and publishing of materials on ethics and transparency, iv) awareness raising event on ethics and transparency in judicial process with the participation of media representatives, v) Judicial Ethics Advisory Committee Decisions Symposium in order to inform representatives from CoC, public institutions and international organisations on the functions of the Committee and the decisions, vi) Strategy of Transparency Draft Report and Communication Strategy and Action Plan for the Court of Cassation have been prepared, vii) Satisfaction Survey of the Court of Cassation has been implemented among lawyers through 79 Bar Associations and the draft survey report was prepared. Additional activities further contributed the success of the Project, achievement of its results and dissemination of experiences and outputs. Istanbul Declaration on Transparency in the Judicial Process and its Implementation Measures were recommended by the Plenary of Commission on Crime Prevention and Criminal Justice (CCPCJ) under the UN Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC) as a result of two weeks of intense negotiations in Vienna and finally was adopted by ECOSOC on 23 July 2019.

-Increase the number of the facilitators (Public Prosecutors, Reporter Judges,Personnel and Members) received ToT program on ethics -Organize 5 dissemination program on ethics for the Public Prosecutors, Reporter Judges,Personnel and Members -Organize consultation group meeting for the preparation of the Draft Transparency and Communication Strategy. -Initiate survey study to understand the satisfaction level of the users of the services of Court of Cassation -Organize 4th International Summit of High Courts reaffirm the Istanbul Declaration on Transparency in the Judicial Process, and to consider and adopt its Draft Implementation Measures.

-56 Personnel, 14 Public Prosecutors, 26 Rapporteur Judges received ToT Program on ethics -400 Personnel, Rapporteur Judges and Public Prosecutors,Members have participated to dissemination program on ethics. Programs have been moderated by the facilitators who have attend to the ToT Programs. -Consultation group meeting was organized for the preparation of the Transparency and Communication Strategy. The meeting was organized with 115 participants. (Public Prosecutors, Reporter Judges, Personnel and Members of Court of Cassation,representatives from media,RTUK, judiciary actors, universities) -Draft Transparency Strategy was prepared by international expert. It is expected to be finalized until June 2019 -Draft Communication Strategy was prepared by national expert. It is expected to be finalized until 2019 -Methodology and questionnaire of the survey was prepared by national expert. The questionnaire was disseminated among the 79 bar association and total of 724 feedback was received from the attorneys. The number of the feedback for the survey is expected to be increased and the final survey report is expected to be finalized until June 2019. -4th International Summit of High Courts was organized on 11-12 October 2018 to reaffirm the Istanbul Declaration on Transparency in the Judicial Process, and to consider and adopt its Draft Implementation Measures. Draft Implementation Measures was reviewed and adopted by the participation of the representatives from high courts from different countries from different continents.
